intro: Centrosolenia congesta, commonly known as the clustered centrosolenia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow-orange flowers arranged in dense clusters, giving it its common name. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Centrosolenia congesta is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
